beginner.name: Affirmation Bot
beginner.desc:
author: dfoo

In these troubling times, I made a friendly bot to affirm you and tell you nice things...

beginner.name: Based 64
beginner.desc:
author: dfoo

My friend gynvael told me that base64 has some interesting properties...

beginner.name: Evil Snek
beginner.desc:
author: dfoo

Help!! Evil snek has put me in jail and won't let me execute whatever commands I want :( :( Can you help me break free?

beginner.name: Galactic Shuttle
beginner.desc:
author: RJCyber

I need to catch the next space shuttle but it seems like there are not many seats left! I need two tickets to be able to fly (for me and my buddy). Do you thing you can get me on the shuttle?

beginner.name: Nishang
beginner.desc:
author: serioton

Analyze the provided network capture to uncover what was downloaded to the victim’s machine.

beginner.name: Shuffle
beginner.desc:
author: yun

OwO an easy crypto!

beginner.name: The Needle
beginner.desc:
author: dxler

You are presented with a simple search tool, an interface to a vast and hidden archive of information. Your mission is to find a single, specific secret hidden within. The tool is your only guide, but it is notoriously cryptic. You'll need to use clever queries and careful observation to uncover the prize.

blockchain.name: Dinosaur Park
blockchain.desc:
author: zeptoide

Are you brave enough to face the raptor and claim the legendary golden egg?

blockchain.name: Solidity Jail 1
blockchain.desc:
author: zeptoide

Bash Jail? Boring. Pyjail? Too Common.

Introducing for the first time, Solidity Jail!
Make a contract to read the flag!

blockchain.name: Solidity Jail 2
blockchain.desc:
author: zeptoide

Enough with the easy challenges.
How about you try something... more... interesting?

crypto.name: Cheops
crypto.desc:
author: Maximxls

Some symmetric crypto for a change.

crypto.name: FaultyCurve
crypto.desc:
author: Warri

ECDLP is so fun to write! Except...sagemath seems to break for mine upon initialisation, guess I'll have to do everything in python....

Note: The sagemath error in question can be traced in the latest version of sage

crypto.name: IsogenyMaze2
crypto.desc:
author: Warri

There was a maze last last year called Isogeny Maze. Here's the bootleg sequel.

https://github.com/Social-Engineering-Experts/SEETF-2023-Public/tree/2588dd0358cb83c8e7c6eb63743c2fe90e35a5b1/challs/crypto/isogeny-maze

crypto.name: LFSR Hamster
crypto.desc:
author: GMO_Goat

Try and catch the LFSR Hamster 🐹

crypto.name: Layered Signatures
crypto.desc:
author: gilcu3

Cryptographic signatures are nice and well designed but sometimes look too simple. I have been thinking about making them more complicated to achieve the so called security by obscurity forbidden fruit.

crypto.name: Lets Prove It Once More
crypto.desc:
author: GMO_Goat

This chall is based on a Cryptohack challenge named Let's Prove It Again made by Ectario.
This time nobody can prove me wrong...

forensic.name: emaG 1
forensic.desc:
author: Odin

We found a weird program ran inside our machine. Could you help me find out what it is?

misc.name: Just Crack It
misc.desc:
hash-cracking

author: spipm

We have his password history. I managed to extract the hashes during his daily run. They say he re-uses passwords. Can you crack them?

$2b$12$q3aBDUHrNGmf9IUDWSUEru3nyIFVFAOmcgUAXdXg7Ij7D/vCruG4e $2b$12$eLPIYYyXgh5D6o.tmBzaausERDyRWdT2AM31ToNODkEfkLU2NdxNS $2b$12$ZxU6azKQlotbIr8TojsU5.QoDLWKdwazipjR/dP7MvGJboyp.0X0G

The flag is wwf{final_password}.

misc.name: Non Functional Calculator
misc.desc:
jail

author: Hydroxylhydrogen

I found this calculator on the roadside, don't know why it's broken

misc.name: Non Functional Calculator 2
misc.desc:
author: Hydroxylhydrogen

Dropped the calculator, now it's even more broken and only calculates x???

misc.name: Ouroboros
misc.desc:
author: yun

Is your code a true ouroboros?

misc.name: World Wide Flags 2
misc.desc:
author: yun

Last year's WWF challenge was too easy~ We made it impossible this time <3

You have to guess 4 flags at the same time, 100 times. Good luck!

misc.name: bf jail
misc.desc:
author: dfoo

Jail but with my best friend? That doesn't sound too bad. Oh wait...

osint.name: Flag from Temu
osint.desc:
author: vizer

Jasper Croft is known for trading all sorts of goods across the internet. But lately, he’s put up something... unusual. A rare item that’s caught the attention of many. Can you uncover what it is before someone else does?

Flag format: wwf{flag_from_temu}
*all lowercase

osint.name: Lost 1
osint.desc:
easy geosint

author: vizer

I'm lost, please tell me where I am?

Flag format: wwf{51.945,59.402}

osint.name: Memories Linger On
osint.desc:
author: vizer

Can you trace back the memory he tried to preserve?

Flag format: wwf{memories_linger_on}
*all lowercase

pwn.name: Aliasing Proplems
pwn.desc:
author: Maximxls

Let's see what are all those rules for.

pwn.name: Arm World
pwn.desc:
author: BlackCat

This is easy ARM challenge. Good Luck.

pwn.name: Awesome Flip
pwn.desc:
author: 4ncientH

Can you flip as fast as you could? The time limit might hold you back.

pwn.name: Giggity Ropity Goo
pwn.desc:
author: buddurid

Lets see if you can 🪢 your way out

pwn.name: Heapstar
pwn.desc:
author: buddurid

The world is full of useless apps, let me just add another one.

pwn.name: Nocturne
pwn.desc:
author: buddurid

nocturne just ulted. It's all darkness and he's on top of you, lets see how you EXIT the situation .

rev.name: Bad Apple
rev.desc:
author: yun

My video player dies after half way through the video, I couldn't figure out why, could you fix it for me?

    Run this in your terminal with java -jar
    Try unplug and plug your earphones

rev.name: Emulator
rev.desc:
mobile

author: em07robot

Inside an emulator, reality bends - only shadows find the hidden truth.
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pyS7nYENVczLfN2GfAC3KJEiJYY7_IKU/view

rev.name: Flag Checker
rev.desc:
author: yun

Classic beginner flag checker challenge.

rev.name: Legacy Snake Game
rev.desc:
author: havertz

I have developed a snake game on an Arduino board, but due to some difficulties I couldn't give everyone this board to experience so I migrated it to a linux program (including its legacy encryption scheme) so everyone can play it widely.
Hope you guys will like it :D

Flag format: WWF{}

rev.name: Nim Yong Un
rev.desc:
author: pingpwn

Our agents captured some North Korean military software. Your task: find the correct launch code!

rev.name: Nyancat Premium
rev.desc:
author: pingpwn

Nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan nyan...

(wrap the correct license key inside wwf{})

rev.name: Rhythmic Vault
rev.desc:
author: Maximxls

Brand new, fun and race-free verification for my flags. NOTE: Owning the game is not neccesary nor helpful in solving the task. Everything you need is oficially downloadable for free!

rev.name: Stretch
VM
rev.desc:
author: Colonel

Why you don't test your reversing skills on our VM?

web.name: A Blank Login
web.desc:
author: spipm

My database subject matter expert helped me design a login portal, so now it uses three database engines. As long as it works, right? He also gave some tips on security:

    We use bcrypt, which is one of the best password hashing algorithms out there.
    We make sure to rotate passwords on every run.
    There is even an audit trail for administrators to detect malicious activity! Do you think there is room for improvement?

web.name: DDNSSEC Docker Domain Name System Security Extensions
web.desc:
author: spipm

Check it out! I'm managing my internal Docker DNS via my regular DNS. This allows me to easily switch internal servers from my registrar's dashboard. My registrar uses DNSSEC, and I'll utilize that to make my Docker DNS secure as well. DNS synchronization can take some time, so I made this tool to test if my record points to a working internal status server.

web.name: Domain of Doom
web.desc:
author: dxler

You're querying domains, but some lead to dangerous places

    The flag is hidden in an environment variable.

web.name: Domain of Doom Revenge
web.desc:
author: dxler

You're querying domains, but some lead to dangerous places

    The flag is hidden in an environment variable.

web.name: Ransom Waifu 2
web.desc:
author: yun

The hacker's ransomware has locked up my anime waifus AGAIN ! This time they added server side password validation! 😭
